result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:59 PM (64-06) Defendant Stephanie N Vierck in court.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Stephanie N Vierck.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Defense acknowledge receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client. 
Speedy trial reserved.

Adj. 3:02PM
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.
